title: No Reasons to Own: Software Stocks Sink on Fear of New AI Tool
description: The release of a new artificial intelligence tool from startup Anthropic on Jan. 12 rekindled fears about disruption that weighed on software makers in 2025. TurboTax owner Intuit Inc. tumbled 16% last week, its worst since 2022, while Adobe Inc. and Salesforce Inc., which makes customer relationship management software, both sank more than 11%.
content:
The new year was supposed to bring opportunities for beaten-down software stocks. Instead, the group is off to its worst start in years.
The release of a new artificial intelligence tool from startup Anthropic on Jan. 12 rekindled fears about disrupt... [5252 chars]

title: Insurers embrace AI in tech upgrade
description: Thailand's insurance industry is stepping up efforts to rapidly adopt artificial intelligence (AI) as the technology reshapes business operations, while introducing a more competitive landscape and new fraud-related risks to the sector.

title: Artificial Intelligence is making the global wealth gap even worse
description: According to a new Oxfam report, billionaire wealth increased three times faster in 2025 than the average annual rate over the previous five years. This period coincided with the AI-fueled stock market boom in the US.
content:

title: More than half of Britons are on edge over AI
description: The Edelman Trust Barometer revealed that 58 per cent in the UK were anxious about artificial intelligence, the highest out of the US, Germany, Brazil and China.
content:
Britons are more likely than those in other major economies to fear being left behind by the rise in artificial intelligence, according to a report published ahead of the Davos summit.

title: Trump's voice in a new Fannie Mae ad is generated by artificial intelligence, with his permission
description: What sounds like President Donald Trump narrating a new Fannie Mae ad actually is an AI-cloned voice reading text, according to a disclaimer in the video
content:
NEW YORK wit (AP) — What sounds like President Donald Trump narrating a new Fannie Mae ad actually is an AI-cloned voice reading text, according to a disclaimer in the video.

title: Trump’s voice in a new Fannie Mae ad is generated by artificial intelligence, with his permission
description: What sounds like President Donald Trump narrating a new Fannie Mae ad actually is an AI-cloned voice reading text, according to a disclaimer in the video.
